intro: Thlaspi freynii, commonly known as Freyn's cabbages, is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, round or elongated seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-like, and covered in a fine layer of white or grayish hairs. Thlaspi freynii is adapted to survive in harsh environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
